articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party Leader
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from V.V. Zhirinovsky, chairman of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, on April 12.
					 The chairman in the message sent warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun). 
					
					 The message recalled that Kim Il Sung put the nation's economy, culture, science and technology, etc. on a modern level while leading the DPRK.
					
					 The message noted that Kim Il Sung would be remembered by the Korean people as their tender-hearted father, wishing Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the Korean people prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Pakistani President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Pakistani President
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message on April 12 from Asif Ali Zardari, president of Pakistan.
					 The Pakistani president in the message said that he was very pleased to send the best wishes and warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK on the happy occasion of the 101st birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The message expressed the belief that the friendship and mutual assistance between the two countries would steadily grow stronger.
					
					 It most sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the people of the DPRK steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian President 
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message on April 15 from Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj.
					 The Mongolian president extended his heartfelt congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 101st anniversary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He expressed his conviction that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between Mongolia and the DPRK would steadily grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the two countries in the future and wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people development and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Congratulatory Message from Ugandan President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Congratulatory Message from Ugandan President
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of Uganda, on April 12.
					 The Ugandan president in his message extended warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un, the government of the DPRK and its people on behalf of the government and people of Uganda on the occasion of the 101st birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It recalled that President Kim Il Sung converted the DPRK into a country of great single-minded unity and achieved great socio-economic progress through his devoted service for its people all his life. 
					
					 The message highly appreciated the life and great exploits of Kim Il Sung and expressed hope that the excellent bilateral relations with Kim Jong Un, his government and people would steadily grow stronger.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people prosperity.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Kang Pan Sok's Statue, Grave
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Kang Pan Sok's Statue, Grave
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the statue of Kang Pan Sok, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the women's movement in Korea, in Chilgol Revolutionary Site and her grave in Mangyongdae on Sunday, her 121st birth anniversary.
					 Seen standing before the statue and grave were wreaths sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok and Kim Yong Chun and other senior officials, the chairman of a friendly party, and officials of party and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, those in the field of education, service personnel and Pyongyangites.
					
					 Laid before the statue and grave were wreaths in the name of the C.C., the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Also placed there were wreaths in the name of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, military academies, educational institutions, revolutionary schools and party and power organs, farms, etc.  in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to her, recollecting her noble life and feats for bringing up President Kim Il Sung to be the sun of the nation and dedicating herself to the liberation of the country and people's freedom and happiness.

articles.title: Chongwadae Security Room Chief's Anti-DPRK Remarks Blasted
articles.content:
Chongwadae Security Chief's Anti-DPRK Remarks Blasted
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Traitor Kim Jang Su, security chief of Chongwadae in south Korea, shortly ago, let loose a whole string of jargons. He blustered he was of the view that the north was not capable of starting an all-out war, but it is poised to ignite a local war any time and so it is necessary to retaliate against it by all means by targeting bases of provocation and supporting and commanding forces when the north provokes. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 His remarks are a clear proof of the reckless scenario of the south Korean puppet regime to get on the nerves of the DPRK and deliberately escalate the tension between the north and the south in a bid to ignite a war against the DPRK at any cost.
					
					 The military muscle of the DPRK including nuclear deterrent is so tremendous that the south Korean authorities can neither predict nor estimate as they are mere colonial puppets of the U.S. 
					
					 This is evidenced by the ambiguous judgment made by the U.S. ruling quarters of the nuclear capability of the DPRK. It is quite natural for the puppet regime to be badly informed of the north as it depends on information provided by the U.S.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the reckless actions taken by such ignorant persons may push the situation into the outbreak of a nuclear war any time. The war drumbeat made by   Kim Jang Su is an open declaration that south Korea would ignite a nuclear war against the north through its practical action, not threat.
					
					 The DPRK would like to warn Kim once again that he had better stop gambling over the fate of the south Koreans. He should not forget that his reckless tongue lashing may bring a horrible disaster to south Korea.
					
					 The south Korean authorities had better bear in mind that the military actions of the DPRK are neither bluff nor threat but practical ones and what remains is to mercilessly punish the provocateurs.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Regime's Hideous Provocation against North
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Regime's Hideous Provocation against North
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces committed such thrice-cursed crime as letting ultra-right conservative gangsters meet in downtown Seoul in broad daylight on the Day of the Sun to defame the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a bylined article terms this crime unpardonable hideous provocation.
					
					 The article says:
					
					 Those gangsters are elders more dead than alive who live on a petty amount of money given by the puppet regime in return for their evil acts perpetrated against the north. Such worst hooliganism would be unthinkable without the patronage and connivance of the puppet authorities.
					
					 The present authorities are going reckless, far from drawing a lesson from the miserable end of their predecessors. The recent hooliganism self-exposed that they are just the same as the Lee Myung Bak group in their confrontation stance.
					
					 In a reaction to the ultimatum issued by the north to mercilessly punish those who hurt the supreme dignity of the nation, they let loose such sophism that "it is hard to understand the action and what happened was an expression of freedom". This was nothing but ridiculous rhetoric to justify their hideous crime. Great irony is that they are pointing an accusing finger at the DPRK, crying out for "an end to threat". This behavior is lashing the service personnel and people of the DPRK into great fury as it reminds one of a guilty party filing the suit first.
					
					 Resolute is the DPRK's stand toward the above-said crime. Under present situation where the inter-Korean relations have been driven into the state of a war, it is a legitimate exercise of the inviolable right for the DPRK to react to the hostile forces' provocation through a practical retaliatory action, not by talking.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestlers, Judoka Prove Successful at Int'l Tournaments
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestlers, Judoka Prove Successful at Int'l Tournaments
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK wrestlers Pak Yong Mi and Hwang Ryong Hak came first in the women's 48kg freestyle and men's 60kg freestyle respectively at the 2013 Asian Wrestling Championship.
					 Wrestler Yang Kyong Il placed second in the men's 55kg freestyle and So Sim Hyang and Han Kum Ok third in the women's 51kg and 55kg freestyle events.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK judoka Sol Kyong bagged a silver medal in the women's 78kg category at the 2013 Asian Judo Championship.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle against U.S. Supported by Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle against U.S. Supported by Foreign Personages
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Personages of Nigeria and France issued statements on April 8 and 10 assailing the war drills of the U.S. and south Korean warmongers.
					 Al Hassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said the situation on the Korean Peninsula is inching close to the brink of a war due to the mad-cap joint military drills of the U.S. and the south Korean bellicose forces.
					
					 The sky, ground and seas of south Korea are littered with latest nuclear war hardware and means of the U.S., the chairman noted, adding:
					
					 The U.S. is to wholly blame for this alarming situation on the peninsula as it has introduced latest war hardware into south Korea and its vicinity.
					
					 Followers of the Juche idea in Nigeria and the world peace-loving people strongly denounce these war moves of the U.S. and south Korea.
					
					 We extend invariable support and solidarity to the Korean people in their final sacred action.
					
					 Robert Charvin, vice-chairman of the France-Korea Friendship Association, said the DPRK solemnly declared its will to take military counter-measures against the escalating military provocations of the U.S. and its allies.
					
					 The progressives and peace-loving forces in the world are expressing serious concern over the U.S. war moves against the DPRK and urging the U.S. to immediately halt the risky nuclear war maneuvers and promptly opt for concluding a peace treaty with the DPRK.
					
					 The friends of the DPRK and progressive lawyers fully support struggle of the Korean people.

articles.title: No War Drills, but Peace Treaty Yes: South Koreans
articles.content:
No War Drills But Peace Treaty: South Koreans
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Media and Academic Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration made public a joint statement on April 17 calling for a halt to the war drills and the settlement  of the crisis on the Korean Peninsula through the  conclusion of a peace treaty.
					 The statement referred to the fact that the situation on the Korean Peninsula is inching close to the brink of a war.
					
					 It accused the U.S. of having massively deployed strategic nuclear weapons in south Korea in wanton violation of the Armistice Agreement since the very day of its conclusion and staged war drills aimed at preemptive nuclear attack against the north. 
					
					 Having designated the north as a target of its preemptive nuclear attack, the U.S. has escalated the danger of a war, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 The outbreak of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula should not be allowed as it will cause the worst tragedy in history. To this end it is necessary to build a peace-keeping mechanism and root out the very source of war.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean authorities should stop hostile remarks and war drills against the north and opt for concluding a peace treaty.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Urges U.S. to Roll back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Urges U.S. to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held the 163rd meeting for independent and peaceful reunification outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on April 15.
					 The speakers at the meetings said the U.S. retraction of its hostile policy toward the DPRK is a key to improving the situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 There will be no change as long as the U.S. ratchets up its hostile policy, persisting in sanctions and war drills against the DPRK, they added.
					
					 They denounced the U.S. and Japan for making desperate efforts to realize their military ambition, taking advantage of the crisis on the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. is pressurizing south Korea to buy F-35 fighter jets while Japan is openly revealing its scheme to reinvade Korea, they noted.
					
					  Neither stealth fighters nor missile shield can defuse the crisis on the peninsula, they noted, urging the U.S. to rescind its hostile policy toward the north and opt for dialogue with it.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Chinese Province
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Chinese Province
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A 7.0-magnitude quake hit Lushan County in Ya'an City, Sichuan Province, China Saturday.
					 Its epicenter was 13 km deep underground in the county.
					
					 The quake left 58 people dead and at least 2,200 wounded as of that day. A total of 120,000 were evacuated.
					
					 Relief work is going on there.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Seeking Benefit from Crisis on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Seeking Benefit from Crisis on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean weekly Media Today carried an article on April 17 denouncing Japan for hamstringing the efforts to achieve peace on the Korean Peninsula. 
					 It accused Japan of its behavior contrary to the peaceful settlement of the situation on the Korean Peninsula, talking about its Self-Defence Forces' reaction in contingency.
					
					 The statement recalled that the Japanese ambassador to south Korea addressing a seminar on April 17 said that the SDF would make efforts to secure a sea route and that the majority of personnel and supplies heading for the Korean Peninsula should go via the U.S. forces bases in Japan when necessary.
					
					 Earlier, the Japanese Prime Minister said at talks with the U.S. secretary of State that Washington should neither make haste to have dialogue with the north nor forget what happened in the past.
					
					 All the facts indicate Japan wants a military conflict on the Korean Peninsula in the final analysis.
					
					 The south Korean public is becoming increasingly critical of Japan trying hard to benefit from the crisis on the peninsula in a bid to justify its military build-up.

articles.title: Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held in Mexico
articles.content:
Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held in Mexico
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A meeting for solidarity with the Korean people was held in Mexico City on April 10.
					 Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, leader of the National Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, said in his speech that the situation on the Korean Peninsula has reached the brink of a war due to the moves of the U.S. and its allies, adding:
					
					 To cope with the increasing war threat from the U.S., the DPRK nullified the Armistice Agreement, launched an all-out action against the U.S. and solemnly clarified its will to safeguard the sovereignty and dignity of the country and nation.
					
					 It is very just for the DPRK to have access to nuclear deterrence to cope with the constant nuclear threat of the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK is a world-class military power with diversified nuclear weapons. It is, at the same time, the only socialist power which declared all-out action against the U.S. styling itself the world's sole super power.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Mexico will as always actively support the Worker's Party of Korea and the Korean people in their just struggle to put an end to the imperialist intervention and protect the dignity of the nation and sovereignty of the country.
					
					 The WPK and the Korean people under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un will foil the war maneuvers of the U.S. and its allies and surely build a socialist thriving nation and achieve the country's reunification.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Palestine
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Palestine
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Uphold Independence" was published in booklet by the Palestine Liberation People's Front on April 14.
					 The work, made public on September 7, Juche 70 (1981), clarifies that it is a requirement of the present era to adhere to the independence in the activity of the party and the state.
					
					 It indicates the Juche idea is a man-centered philosophy.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Report Carried by Zimbabwean Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Report Carried by Zimbabwean Paper
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Zimbabwean paper Herald on April 15 carried a detailed gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's report at the March, 2013 plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Brief Biography Reported by Nepalese TV Broadcasting Service
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Brief Biography Reported by Nepalese TV Broadcasting Service 
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Sakirmata TV Broadcasting Service of Nepal reported the brief biography of President Kim Il Sung on April 14 and 15.

articles.title: Day of Sun Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign magazines and newspapers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 An article praising the exploits of President Kim Il Sung illustrated with his beaming image was posted on a Vietnamese internet magazine on April 10.
					
					 The article cited facts that the President paid deep attention to the improvement of the people's standard of living and pursued a policy of love for people with charisma.
					
					 Kim Il Sung is highly lauded not only by the Korean people but by all other people of the world, the article noted, adding that he was the tender-hearted father of humankind. 
					
					 On the same day the Egyptian paper Al－Misaiya said in an article titled "History's Appreciation" that Kim Il Sung was an outstanding great man who was praised by everybody irrespective of ideology, social system, political view and religion.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper Natun Katha on April 8 carried an article titled "Songun Korea".
					
					 It said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung embarked in his early years on the road of struggle for liberating the Korean people who were groaning under the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 He gave top priority to the building of regular armed forces and the development of the national defense industry, inflicting a heavy defeat upon the U.S. imperialists who provoked the Korean war and creditably protecting the sovereignty and the dignity of the country.
					
					 The DPRK emerged an independent power from a weak colonial nation. This reality is the historic inevitability of Songun.
					
					 The Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times on April 7 carried an article praising Kim Il Sung's exploits.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Il Sung Lauded by Pakistani Personages
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Il Sung Lauded by Pakistani Personages
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Pakistani personages issued statements on April 12 and 13 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 Haji Mohammad Said, chairman of the Pakistan Labor Federation, said the workers and other people of Pakistan remember with deep emotion the life of the President, who performed undying exploits, holding aloft the banner of independence.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The President is deeply revered by all people.
					
					 He was an outstanding thinker and theoretician, great patriot and tender-hearted father of the people.
					
					 On behalf of the labor federation, I would like to pay highest tribute to Kim Il Sung, guardian of justice who made an undying contribution to the global cause of independence.
					
					 Berkat Ullah, chairman of the Pakistani Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea, said:
					
					 After liberating the country through an anti-Japanese armed struggle the President founded the party and state, led the war against the U.S. to victory and turned the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence in a short span of time.
					
					 He devoted his all to the happiness of the country and its people, national reunification and victory of the human cause of independence.
					
					 His greatest exploit was that he fully applied the immortal Juche idea to the specific conditions of the DPRK.
					
					 The President is always alive in the hearts of progressive mankind.

articles.title: Book Praising DPRK Published in Russia
articles.content:
Book Praising DPRK Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Book "The great single-minded unity" was published by the Russian paper Patriot Office on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 The book carried portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il and a photo of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Edited in the book are articles "The leader of the nation, son of the people", "He devoted all his life to the people", "The place bright with a shining star" and poetic works created by Russian personages of various strata in praise of the exploits of the great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 A book releasing ceremony was held at the Patriot Office on April 12.
					
					 Mikhail Demskov, editor-in-chief of the paper, said in a speech that the DPRK could imposingly rise as an invulnerable fortress of socialism centered on the popular masses guided by the Juche idea thanks to the President.
					
					 The DPRK turned into a nuclear weapons state and a military power thanks to leader Kim Jong Il's Songun politics.
					
					 The Korean people are frustrating every vicious move of the U.S. and its allies for a war as they are having the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the top posts of the party, state and army.
					
					  If a war breaks out in Korea, we will hold arms and join the Korean comrades in fighting against the common enemy, U.S. imperialism.
					
					 The DPRK is, indeed, a military power standing up against U.S. imperialism, the most ferocious in the world.
					
					 We will actively introduce the greatness of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and Kim Jong Un.
